intro: Tibouchina apparicioi, commonly known as the pink tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade. Tibouchina apparicioi is also noted for its attractive bracts that enhance its visual display.
